britishIndian.Introduction: British trading posts in India were first established by the East India Company (EIC) early in the seventeenth century, which quickly evolved into larger colonies covering a significant part of the subcontinent. Early settlements or factories included Masulipatnam (1611) and Madras (1640) in the south, Surat (1612) in the west, and modern-day Kolkata (1698–99) in the east. These colonies gave rise to Madras Presidency, Bombay Presidency, and Bengal Presidency, and each Presidency had a separate coinage and monetary system. In 1835, the EIC adopted a unified system of coinage throughout all British possessions in India and the older Presidency system was discontinued. After the Indian Rebellion of 1857, control of EIC territories passed to the British Crown. Coinage issued after 1857 were under the authority of the monarch as India became part of the British Empire. With the Royal Titles Act 1876, Victoria took the title "Empress of India", so in 1877 coin inscriptions changed from Victoria Queen to Victoria Empress. There was a transition period after India gained independence on 15 August 1947, and the first set of republic India coins were issued in 1950.

Coin.Title: 1 Rupee - Shah Alam II
Coin.Obverse:
Legend in Persian: Sikka zad bar haft kishwar saya fazl Ilah Hami ud-din Muhammad, Shah Alam Badshah (AH) 1229
Lettering: ١٢٢٩
Translation: Defender of the religion of Muhammad, Shah Alam Emperor Shadow of the divine favour, put his stamp on the seven climes, (AH) 1229
Coin.Reverse:
Legend in Persian: Zarb Muhammadabad Banaras sanat 17/(RY)49 julus maimanat manus
Lettering: ١٧ ۴۹
Translation: Struck at Muhammadabad Banaras in the 17/(RY)49 year of his reign of tranquil prosperity.

Coin.Title: 1 Rupee - Shah Alam II
Coin.Obverse:
Legend in Persian: Sikka Zad Bar Haft Kishwur Sayaye Fazl Shah Alam Badshah Elah Hami Din Mohammad
Translation: Defender of the Muhammadan faith, Reflection of Divine Excellence, the Emperor Shah Alam has stuck this coin to be current throughout the seven climes
Coin.Reverse:
Legend in Persian: Zarb Murshidabad Sanat 19 Julus Maimanat Manus
Lettering: ١٩
Translation: Struck at Murshidabad in the 19th year of his prosperous reign

Coin.Title: 1 Pie
Coin.Obverse:
Value in English and Bengali
Lettering: ONE PIE এক পাই
Translation: One pie
Coin.Reverse:
Value in Urdu and Devanagari
Lettering: ١ یک پاي ऎक पाई
Translation: One pie

Coin.Title: 1 Pice - Shah Alam II
Coin.Obverse:
Legend in Persian: sanah julus 37 Shah Alam Badshah (bottom to top)
Lettering: ســـنہ جلوس٣٧ شـــاه عالم باد شـــاه
Translation: In the 37th year of the Emperor Shah Alam II
Coin.Reverse:
The value in three languages:
Lettering: এক পায় সিককা یک پای سکہ એક પાઇ થીકા
Translation: one pice coin Bengali: ekpai sikka. Persian: ayk paay sika. Gujarati: eka paaī sīkaa.

Coin.Title: 1 Pie
Coin.Obverse:
Coat of arms of the East India Company On the ribbon is the legend: Auspicio Regis Et Senatus Anglia, date below. All within a raised toothed rim.
Lettering: 1825 AUSP. REGIS SEN. ANGLIAE
Translation: By the authority of the King and Parliament of England
Coin.Reverse:
The value in Persian:Yek pai, with a value numeral above and the AH date below. Flanked by sprays surrounded by a raised, toothed rim.
Lettering: 1 دو پاي ١٢۴٠ سنه
Translation: One Pie year (AH) 1240

Coin.Title: 1 Pice
Coin.Obverse:
United East India Company balemark with date below. Within a toothed border(the border is not usually visible)
Lettering: VEIC 18xx
Translation: United East India Company
Coin.Reverse:
Balanced scales with legend in Persian between pans:Adil
Lettering: عدل
Translation: Just or fair

Coin.Title: 1 Pie
Coin.Obverse:
Coat of arms of the East India Company On the ribbon is the legend: Auspicio Regis Et Senatus Anglia, date below, value (Pie) above - all within a plain raised rim.
Lettering: 1833 AUSP:REG SEN:ANG:
Translation: By the authority of the King and Parliament of England
Coin.Reverse:
Balanced scales, value above(PIE) Legend in Persian between the pans: Adil AH date (1248) below - all within a plain raised rim.
Lettering: PIE عدل ١۲۴۸
Translation: Just or fair 1248

Coin.Title: ¼ Anna Paisa
Coin.Obverse:
Coat of arms of the East India Company: 2 lions, St George's cross on the crest and flags, motto on the ribbon "Auspicio Regis et Senatus Anglia"
Lettering: EAST INDIA COMPANY AUSP : REGIS SENAT : ANGLIA 1830
Translation: By the Command of the King and Parliament of England
Coin.Reverse:
Balanced scales,legend in Persian between pans: Adil Date (AH 1246) below
Lettering: QUARTER ANNA عدل ١٢۴۶
Translation: Just or fair 1246

Coin.Title: ¼ Anna Paisa
Coin.Obverse:
Coat of arms of the East India Company, date below On the ribbon is the legend: Auspicio Regis Et Senatus Anglia - all within a plain raised rim.
Lettering: 1833 AUSP:REG SEN:ANG:
Translation: By the authority of the King and Parliament of England
Coin.Reverse:
Coat of arms of the East India Company, date below On the ribbon is the legend: Auspicio Regis Et Senatus Anglia - all within a plain raised rim.
Lettering: 1833 AUSP:REG SEN:ANG:
Translation: By the authority of the King and Parliament of England

Coin.Title: 1/12 Anna
Coin.Obverse:
Coat of arms of the East India Company: 2 lions, St George's cross on the crest and flags, motto on the ribbon "AUSP: REG: SEN: ANG:" ("Auspicio Regis et Senatus Angliae") All within a plain rim
Lettering: 1848 AUSP: REG: SEN: ANG:
Translation: By the Command of the King and Parliament of England
Coin.Reverse:
The value in English and Persian: Thalath pai value within laurel wreath. English legend surrounds within a plain rim.
Lettering: EAST INDIA COMPANY 1/12 ANNA ثلث پاي
Translation: One third pice

Coin.Title: ¼ Anna
Coin.Obverse:
Monarch William IV Coat of arms of the East India Company: 2 lions, St George's cross on the crest and flags, motto on the ribbon "Auspicio Regis et Senatus Angliae"
Lettering: 1835 AUSP: REG: SEN: ANG:
Translation: By the Command of the King and Parliament of England
Coin.Reverse:
The value in English within a wreath of laurel:ONE QUARTER ANNA Between the tips of the wreath is the value in Persian:"Yek Pai" = One Pice
Around this the legend: EAST INDIA COMPANY All within a raised, plain rim.
Lettering: EAST INDIA COMPANY یک پای ONE QUARTER ANNA

Coin.Title: ¼ Rupee - Victoria

Translation: Four Annas

Coin.Title: 2 Annas - George V

Crowned bust of King George V, left, English legend within circle, date outside

Denomination in English within square, "Two annas" in 4 languages Urdu, Bengali, Nagari and Telugu outside

Coin.Title: 8 Annas - George V
Coin.Obverse:
Bust of King George V facing left, legend in English surrounds
Lettering: GEORGE V KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Edgar Bertram Mackennal
Coin.Reverse:
Denomination and date in center within a scalloped shape inside a double lined square Value (8 annas) in four Indian languages, Urdu, Bengali, Telugu and Devnagari outside the square
Lettering: INDIA 1919 8 ANNAS
Translation: 8 Annas

Coin.Title: 2 Annas - George V Type II
Coin.Obverse:
Crowned bust of King George V left
Lettering: GEORGE V KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Edgar Bertram MacKennal
Coin.Reverse:
Within the circle, date divides legend in English & Urdu (Do Aana), a wreath made of roses, thistle, shamrock leaves and lotus flowers outside the circle, all within a toothed border
Lettering: TWO ANNAS INDIA 1916 دو آنہ
Translation: Two Annas India 1916 Two Annas

Coin.Title: ¼ Rupee - George V
Coin.Obverse:
Crowned bust of King George V left
Lettering: GEORGE V KING EMPEROR

Coin.Reverse:
Within circle, date divides legend in English & Urdu (Chaar Aana). Outside circle, wreath made of roses, thistle, shamrock leaves and lotus flowers. All within a toothed border

Translation: 1/4 RUPEE INDIA 1928 4 Annas (1/4 Rupee)

Coin.Title: ½ Rupee - George V
Coin.Obverse:
Crowned bust of King George V left
Lettering: GEORGE V KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Edgar Bertram MacKennal
Coin.Reverse:
Within the circle, there is the legend "Hasht Aanay" in English and Urdu, along with the denomination and date. The circle is surrounded by a toothed border, which contains a wreath made of roses, thistle, shamrock leaves, and lotus flowers.
Lettering: HALF RUPEE INDIA 1936 هشت آنہ
Translation: Half Rupee India 1936 Eight Annas (1/2 Rupee)

Coin.Title: 1 Rupee - George V

Crowned head of George V facing left with "Pig Elephant" type

Engraver: Edgar Bertram MacKenna

Coin.Title: 1 Rupee - George V

Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Date divides legend in English & Urdu (Chaar Aana) within a circle, with the outside having a wreath made of roses, a thistle, shamrock leaves, and lotus flowers, all within a toothed border
Lettering: 1/4 RUPEE INDIA 1945 چار آنہ
Translation: 1/4 Rupee India 1943 Four annas (1/4 Rupee)

Coin.Title: ¼ Rupee - George VI
Coin.Obverse:
Crowned head of George VI facing left
Lettering: GEORGE VI KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Indian tiger (Panthera tigris), date Value in Nagari, English and Urdu
Lettering: पाव रुपया QUARTER RUPEE پاو روپیہ INDIA 1947
Engraver: P. W. M. Brindley

Coin.Title: ½ Rupee - George VI
Coin.Obverse:
The large second crowned bust of King George VI facing left with small rim decoration
Lettering: GEORGE IV KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Within the circle, the date divides the legend in English & Persian (Hasht Aanay). Outside circle, a wreath made of roses, thistle, shamrock leaves, and lotus flowers, all within a toothed border
Lettering: HALF RUPEE INDIA 1940 هشت آنہ
Translation: Half Rupee India 1940 Eight Annas (Half-Rupee)

Coin.Title: ½ Rupee - George VI
Coin.Obverse:
The small crowned second head of King George VI facing left, surrounded by the legend in English within a large rim decoration
Lettering: GEORGE VI KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Within the circle, the date divides legend in English & Persian (Hasht Aanay). Outside circle, a wreath made of roses, thistle, shamrock leaves and lotus flowers. All within a toothed border
Lettering: HALF RUPEE INDIA 1945 هشت آنہ
Translation: Half Rupee India 1942 Eight Annas (Half Rupee)

Coin.Title: ½ Rupee - George VI
Coin.Obverse:
Crowned head of King George VI facing left
Lettering: GEORGE VI KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Indian tiger (Panthera tigris) facing left, legend and date below. Surrounding this is the value in three languages English, Devnagari (Aadha Rupya) and Persian (Hasht Aanay)
Lettering: आधा रुपया HALF RUPEE هشت آنہ INDIA 1946
Translation: Devnagari : Half Rupee Persian: Eight Annas (= 1/2 rupee)
Engraver: P. W. M. Brindley

Coin.Title: 1 Rupee - George VI
Coin.Obverse:
Bust of George VI facing lefgt. Small second head, large rim decoration
Lettering: GEORGE VI KING EMPEROR 1945
Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Within circle, date divides legend in English & Urdu (Yek Rupya) . Outside circle, wreath made of roses, thistle, shamrock leaves and lotus flowers. All within a toothed border.
Lettering: ONE RUPEE INDIA 1945 یک روپیہ
Translation: One Rupee

Coin.Title: 1 Rupee - George VI
Coin.Obverse:
Crowned head George VI facing left
Lettering: GEORGE VI KING EMPEROR
Engraver: Percy Metcalfe
Coin.Reverse:
Indian tiger (panthera tigris) One rupee (Ek Rupya) in Nagari, English and Urdu
Lettering: एक रूपया ONE RUPEE یک روپیہ INDIA 1947
Translation: One Rupee
Engraver: P. W. M. Brindley
